contentList.content: You can use spellfire to absorb spell energy, fire destructive blasts, or heal others

You have gained mastery over spellfire, a rare and potent gift from Mystra that makes you able to wield raw magical energy. You can obtain Spellfire Charges by absorbing magic from your opponents or yourself. Whether healing allies, devastating foes, or drawing power from other spells, your control over spellfire makes you a formidable force on the battlefield.
A spellfire charge allows to unleash spellfire energy attacks and use spellfire abilities. If you absorb over 5 charges, you'll detonate a spellfire discharge, damaging anything in the area.

As an action, you can expend one or more spellfire charges to unleash a spellfire blast at a target within range. The blast requires a ranged spell attack, and on a hit, it deals spellfire damage per charge expended (max 3) and the number of blasts increases at higher levels. Spellfire damage counts as half Force and half Fire damage.

As an bonus action, you can expend one or more spellfire charges to unleash a spellfire smite at a target within range. The smite requires a weapon attack, and on a hit, it deals spellfire damage per charge expended (max 3). Spellfire damage counts as half Force and half Fire damage.
A detonation occurring when you can't contain all the spellfire within you.

You can use your reaction to absorb a level spell that's targeting you. When you do, you gain spellfire charges. If you exceed your total capacity, the excess charges will deal damage in an area around you.

You can use your reaction to absorb a level [1] spell that's targeting you. When you do, you gain [1] spellfire charges. If you exceed your total capacity, the excess charges will deal damage in an area around you.

You can use your reaction to absorb a level [1] spell that's targeting you. When you do, you gain [1] spellfire charge. If you exceed your total capacity, the excess charges will deal damage in an area around you.

You can use your reaction to absorb a level [1] (or higher) spell that's targeting you. When you do, you gain [1] spellfire charges. If you exceed your total capacity, the excess charges will deal damage in an area around you.
As an action, you can touch a creature and expend one spellfire charge to heal it. This healing is not positive energy and does not harm undead, thus it can be used to heal undead and constructs.
You expend spellfire charges to gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for 1 minute.
As a reaction, you can expend a spellfire charge to attempt to counter another spell without absorbing it.
You can convert a certain number of spellfire charges to one Spell Slot of the corresponding level.
You can create a spellfire charge once per long rest, absorbing a portion of your own magical power instead of spells targeting you.
